alert.note: Alert for Fayette; McDowell; Raleigh; Wyoming (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 28 at 3:59PM EDT until July 28 at 4:30PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: The National Weather Service in Charleston West Virginia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern McDowell County in southern West Virginia... Raleigh County in southeastern West Virginia... Eastern Wyoming County in southern West Virginia... Southeastern Fayette County in southeastern West Virginia... * Until 430 PM EDT. * At 359 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Dry Creek to near Pineville, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Beckley, Welch, Pineville, Mullens, Mabscott, Sophia, Gary, Northfork, Crab Orchard, Dry Creek, Macarthur, Shady Spring, Beaver, Piney View, Stanaford, Coal City, Prosperity, Twin Falls State Park, Daniels, and Bradley. This includes the following highways... West Virginia Turnpike between mile markers 28 and 48. Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 120 and 137. Route 19 between mile markers 1 and 3. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
